result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle James Spence

records.addlTxt:
9:16 AM Defendant Kyle James Spence in court.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Kyle James Spence.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status after arraignment.
Defense has received discovery, but not an offer at this time.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Defendant's Discovery Demand.
Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:06 AM . Defendant Kyle James Spence in court.  Attorney Susan L. Opper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Kyle James Spence. 

The Court calls the matter for an Arraignment.
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:22 AM Defendant Kyle James Spence in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Department Detective Aaron Hoppe sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Opper.  Cross examination by Attorney Rypel.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Rypel objects to bind over and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  The State is asking for an arraignment date.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment back before the Commissioner.  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:45 AM Defendant Kyle James Spence appeared by Zoom with attorney Stephen P. Rypel who appeared by Zoom.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court notes the State filed a letter requesting an adjournment as the State's witnesses were unavailable today.  No objection by Attorney Rypel.  The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Time limits were previously waived.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request to adjourn Preliminary Hearing.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 07-07-2022. "Change matter to status on Prelim. Retaining date and time for scheduling due to Marsy's Law issue. Time limits previously waived and no objection from the defense. Defendant and Defense Counsel may appear in person or with functioning Zoom with both audio and visual."
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

01:17 PM Defendant Kyle James Spence in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Atty. Stephen R. Rypel.

Adjustment Number: 22A 021685,
Payable Number: 466506,
Receipt Number: 22R 023550,
Amount: $20.00
Notice Regarding US Passport for Criminal Defendant
Hearing on June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.    Defendant does not have a passport and is not to apply or receive a passport.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

02:48 PM Defendant Kyle James Spence in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel, as a friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A's son appearing in court.  Victim A's daughter.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 05/20/2022.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
